data.title: Container sort_children oneshot connection removed
data.body:
<!--
README: Incompatibilities and broken features in the current master branch / 3.0-alpha
are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!
-->

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Gentoo Linux, Godot 2.1.2
~~(I've not tested other OSs, I'll check windows later this afternoon)~~
Also, Windows 10, Godot on Steam

**Issue description:**

Opening a scene in the editor with a Container with the "sort_children" signal having a oneshot connection removes the connection.

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Create a new scene
2. Add a Container node (or node that inherits Container)
3. Add a script
4. Connect the "sort_children" signal as a oneshot to a function in the script
5. Save the scene
6. Close the scene
7. Open the scene

The connection is now gone.


**Link to minimal example project:**

[testoneshot.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/767524/testoneshot.zip)

This example project has the container connected to the script (you can verify by checking the .tscn file), when opened in the editor, the connection disappears.

data.title: Should editor allow repositioning of a container's children?
data.body:
<!--
README: Incompatibilities and broken features in the current master branch / 3.0-alpha
are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!
-->

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

This affects all Godot versions with GraphNode


**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->

Moving the GraphNode in the scene editor has no effect on how it is displayed at runtime. Furthermore, the position reset upon reopening the scene in the editor. Programmatically, set_pos has no effect, only set_offset has some effect.

**Steps to reproduce:**

Create a GraphNode in the editor under GraphEdit, move it, and run the scene.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->:

data.title: Remove memdelete of button in GIProbeEditor exit
data.body: This was causing a heap corruption when exiting on windows.

data.title: Close out audio drivers when exiting on Windows.
data.body: Prevents a crash when closing the project manager.

data.title: Removed DX9 Rasterizer in windows
data.body:
This doesn't seem to be needed anymore and the code to free the unused
rasterizer was throwing a memory violation since it was getting set to a
value somehow.

data.title: Enhance TextureButton and TextureRect with resize

Add STRETCH_KEEP_ASPECT_COVERED to TextureRect StretchMode
Make TextureButton to the same resize behavior with TextureRect

Probably fixes #7762

@akien-mga You sure you didn't mean to tag it as "bojidar job" instead?

data.title: ERROR: RasterizerGLES::canvas_light_shadow_buffer_create
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Laptop, Intel HD Graphics 3000, Windows 7 and 10 - Godot version: 2.1.2

**Issue description:**
When just  starts Godot, before any project open, there is error in console appears:

> ERROR: RasterizerGLES::canvas_light_shadow_buffer_create: Condition ' status != 0x8CD5 ' is true. returner: RID()
> At: drivers\gles2\rasterizer_gles2.cpp:8856

The same error appears in Godot debugger when project starts playing. Some big sprites are disappeared in playing project.

**On the same (dual boot) machine running Linux there is no error, and all sprites are in places.**

**Steps to reproduce:**
Just run Godot under Windows, I think it's enough.

![2017-02-08 13 18 23](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1871642/22772034/c0c5cbaa-eeb3-11e6-922f-35294495a071.png)

data.title: OS.get_mouse_mode() returns garbage on OSX
data.body:
Present in 2.1 and master on OSX:

QA thread: https://godotengine.org/qa/12250/input-get_mouse_mode-is-returning-32767-why

`mouse_mode` is not initialized in the constructor of `OS_OSX`. It should be `VISIBLE` I think.

https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/platform/osx/os_osx.mm#L1767

data.title: Timeline based animation editor for Cut Scenes, CGI, etc.
data.body:
Hey Godot Devs,

With the upcoming 3.0 update we are getting an overhauled renderer that supports PBR and better Global Illumination. Would it be possible post 3.0 to get a Timeline based animation editor similar to [After Effects](http://www.indietips.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/02/After-Effects-Iron-Man-Avengers.jpg), [UE4 Sequencer](http://i.imgur.com/CmGhnLv.jpg), or [Timeline](https://blogs.unity3d.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/10-Timeline.jpg)?

I am requesting this as I have a need to make cut scenes in my projects.

data.title: Having an engine.cfg file in ~ (as in /home/username) stops the project list from running
data.body:
My system information: http://pasted.co/ca4970b9

How to reproduce:

1.  Copy a valid engine.cfg from any Godot project to your home folder
2.  Open Godot executable via shortcut or double click.

What happens is that Godot does not open the project list while the cfg file is there, instead it tries to run the project (not in the editor, but actually run it).

data.title: Fixed compilation issues with Visual Studio
data.body: This commit adds the missing `OS_Windows::check_feature_support` function and adds a float cast to a Math::lerp call that was causing VS to complain it could not pick the correct function to override.

data.title: The ._sc_ feature to make godot portable/self-contained cannot be easily created via Windows Explorer
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Windows 10 Pro x64 - latest Godot version as of date.

**Issue description:**

This feature (creating a file called **._sc_**)  allows godot to write the settings in the current folder which godot is executed. Windows Explorer limitations on file creation means that this error will popup:

![ulj4yd0](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7162375/22760045/94a9f21a-ee33-11e6-8327-2bf301b26508.png)

This is bad UX. This means that the solution only works on Windows if a workaround is used (renaming the file via Command Line) which is not user-friendly at all.

While a config setting would be preferred, this issue is fixed by requiring a file that works perfectly in every OS **without workarounds** (example: "is_portable.txt") . Another option would be to provide a download with this file previously created, so the user won't have to create anything. Another, more complex option, would be to have a setting in option to clone the %APPDATA% folder and then delete the previously used folder (to contemplate all user cases)

I repeat, forcing users to work around Windows Explorer limitations (which is arguably the most used file browser for desktop computers) is bad UX.

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Download godot and extract
2. Try and create a file called ._sc_

data.title: Running Godot 2.1.2 and playing music causes static noise
data.body:
<!--
README: Incompatibilities and broken features in the current master branch / 3.0-alpha
are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!
-->
A short disclaimer; I hope this is just an issue with my own computer. Perhaps I have messed something up - or deleted something that I shouldn't. Regardless, just in case I will report it here as a possible bug.

This sound glitch only happens when I run Godot - not when I run other Steam applications, or applications. I have attempted to uninstall and reinstall Godot on Steam, but it does not change anything.
If you have suggestions or ideas of what I could try to troubleshoot the problem, please let me know. :)


**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Running on Linux Mint 18.1 Cinnamon 64-bit
Godot Engine v2.1.2 (Steam)

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Whenever I start Godot Engine, regardless if music is already playing or not - it causes the music that is being played to become very static. The static noise levels matches the music levels being played.

When I run v2.2 alpha custom build, there is no static. Only when I use the steam version. Doing more tests.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Play music.
Start Godot 2.1.2

**Audio Clip of what I am hearing:**
https://clyp.it/klnjopjk

data.title: Shadows from DirectionalLight don't show any more
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux 4.8.11, godot  (master)
NVIDIA Corporation GK106 [GeForce GTX 645 OEM] with nouveau driver, mesa 12.0.6

**Issue description:**
Shadows from DirectionalLight sources don't show up any more. OmniLight and SpotLight work as intended though. I traced the problem back to the following commit:

07bbcf91f79480441fdaa1779f7244cdad6e1ba9 is the first bad commit

Date:   Tue Feb 7 23:48:09 2017 -0300

    basic contact shadows implementation, will most likely need some polishing

**Steps to reproduce:**
Add a DirectionalLight and enable shadows. The shadows will not show up, instead all models in the scene will get slightly darker.

data.title: Added "Scots" locale name, fixing #7630
data.body:
Scots lang code was added, but the name was not, creating a different size in both arrays and causing the crash reported in #7630.
No other fix is needed.

data.title: Nodes names on the scene tree removes the number(s) zero(es) "0" if there is another number on its right side (no matter what is on its left side)
data.body:
Linux Ubuntu 16.04 LTS
Godot 3.0 from master 2017 feb 07

When I create a new node on a scene tree an try to name it "somename01", Godot 3 now rename it like "somename1", this works correctly on Godot 2.x branch

**Steps to reproduce:**
create a new scene, add a node with the "+" button over the scene tree, a Sprite will do, call it "spr_dog01", and the node will be renamed by Godot as "spr_dog1"

This is really inconvenient for a large number of assets where you order them adding zeroes on the name so the asset number eleven isnt within the other first ten
bad practice:
spr_1
spr_11
spr_2
good practice:
spr_01
spr_02
...
spr_10
spr_11

NOTE: this is happening on the tree, but when I create new animations on the AnimationPlayer, I can still call them "idle_01" with the zeroes

Thanks in advance

data.title: Save and restore debug options for each project
Fix zero padding formatting
data.body:
Fix #7602

Test code
```gdscript
func _ready():
	print("%+d" % 1)
	print("%+d" % -22)
	print("%d" % -333)
	print("%+05d" % 1)
	print("%+05d" % -22)
	print("%05d" % -333)
	print("%+5d" % 1)
	print("%+5d" % -22)
	print("%5d" % -333)
```

Result
```
+1
-22
-333
+00001
-00022
-00333
    +1
   -22
  -333
```

This is for 2.1 branch, master should cherrypick this.

data.title: Sound import error
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.1.2, Windows 10 64 bits

From this QA thread, there are issues with audio importing: https://godotengine.org/qa/12172/sound-fx-are-showing-as-empty-in-godot-project


For example, a file (WAV 96000Hz) could not be imported, Godot logged this error:
```
ERROR: ResourceFormatLoaderWAV::load: Format not supported for WAVE file (not PCM). Save WAVE files as uncompressed PCM instead.
   At: scene\io\resource_format_wav.cpp:114
```
Edit: same with 48000Hz files as found by a user on Discord

So I normalized and exported from Audacity as WAV PCM, under a different name: [PistolDraw_reexport44n.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/759380/PistolDraw_reexport44n.zip)
But Godot still can't import it.
Weirder, converted to OGG under another different name, still can't import it, the same error happens.

With the following settings each time;
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311555/22717790/584cb032-ed9d-11e6-9701-db2da1e2b2e5.png)

This error is logged:
```
ERROR: EditorSampleImportPlugin::import: Condition ' smp.is_null() ' is true. returned: ERR_CANT_OPEN
   At: tools\editor\io_plugins\editor_sample_import_plugin.cpp:423
```

The only thing that works is using the WAV file directly without import, provided that it was converted manually beforehand (which makes the importer useless).

I know sound is being reworked for 3.0 as well as a part of the import system, but I don't think this was changed yet?

data.title: Translate ButtonArray text
data.body:
Fix #7636

Test code
```gdscript
extends Control

func _init():
	var trans = Translation.new()
	trans.add_message("test1", "translated_test1")
	trans.add_message("test2", "translated_test2")
	TranslationServer.add_translation(trans)

func _ready():
	pass
```

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8281454/22716660/46d78588-edda-11e6-86b9-276de27b23aa.png)

This is for 2.1 branch, master should cherrypick this.

data.title: Godot sandbox & modding support
data.body:
Introduction
============

Just coming back from GodotCon where I had a really interesting discussion with @Fabless about adding a sandbox feature in Godot. So here is a summary:

Godot with GDscript acts a lot like a web browser with Javascript: a core generic engine running on the user's OS and interpreting some higher level script code.

A cool feature about web browser is they enforce a sandbox pattern: no matter how bad or malicious the high level code is, it can never break you OS (well obviously as long as the sandbox doesn't have security hole !).

However, the big difference with web is a Godot application is provided to the user with both the Godot generic engine and the GDscript code. So one can just add any malicious code to the Godot engine distributed inside his game to trivially bypass the sandbox...

Considering this, the sandbox would be a way not to protect the user from the game developer (you install it software, so you trust him), but to allow out-of-the-box modding.

So the player would be able to download 3rd party mods, put them in a `mod://` folder (this would shadow resources from `res://`) and have the guarantee that thanks to the sandbox only the game can break (just like if you download a bad chrome plugin, it can only mess with the webpages you consult - which is a lot scarier than messing with just a Godot game btw -, not with your entire OS).

@Faless stated this is a dangerous pattern to trust unknown code and so modding should be a feature developers add with custom code, allowing to modders only to change configuration instead of having access to the GDscript.

A quick search on the internet show that there is two way of adding mod into Unity: give full C# access (simple but dangerous way, chosen for example by [KSP](http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/85372-mod-development-links-compilation-some-links-do-not-work-formatting-broken/)) or embed a lua interpreter and expose and API from there (see https://www.roguevector.com/category/mod-support/, https://forum.unity3d.com/threads/making-a-moddable-game.312490/ and https://forum.unity3d.com/threads/could-adding-modding-support-by-loading-modders-assemblies-create-risk-of-malicious-code.447879/)

While I agree trusting unknown code is never good, being able to advertise Godot as a game engine with modding for free seems a big argument given how many indie games tends to build a community around this feature (Factorio, KSP, Minecraft etc.).

In the end, the question is the complexity to add a solid enough sandbox mode for GDscript vs. the benefit of providing powerful-but-safe-enough modding out of the box (I guess we could even provide on the Godot assets site a generic Godot app mods manager which would list the mod available and start the real game with a `--mod-path=...` option configured accordingly).

@Faless thinks if available, this sandbox mode should be activated by default given most games would work pretty well with it and more security for the same price is always better ;-)


Implementation
==============

The idea would be to have a switch in the project configuration to enable/disable sandbox mode for the project.

Enabling the sandbox mode would cause the following changes:


Stub OS singleton
------------------------
OS singleton contains dangerous methods which allow to manipulate processes
such as:
- execute
- kill
- shell_open
- get_process_ID

I think we could create a new `MethodFlags` (like `METHOD_FLAG_UNSAFE`) to easily flag those methods so implementing a check during call would be trivial.


Limited load access
--------------------------
Sandboxed mode should only allow `res://` and `user://` style of path for open.
Beside, only `user://` should allow write mode.
Path should be fully resolved before using it to make sure no malicious path (i.g. `user://../../secret.txt`) can go through the check.

@Faless thing this could still be a trouble given a malicious program could try to write tons of dummy data into the filesystem in order to break it.

We could add rules to limit the size of the files that could be wrote, but then we will have to deal with program doing intensive small I/O to stall the HDD...
This is too cumbersome from my point of view, beside my guess is messing with the HDD this way is really visible and given the attacker cannot steal or destroy any user's information it is a minor issue.

Shared modules
----------------------
Modders should not be able to provide .so modules given those just bypass the sandbox and can do anything. For the moment this is not a concern but this should be taken into account with @bojidar-bg  & @karroffel DLscript making it way to the master.
A solution could be to allow DLscripts only to be loaded from `res://` (so `mod://` can't)

Protect project settings !
---------------------------------
We obviously have to make sure you can't temper the project settings when running it otherwise it would be trivial to disable the sandbox mode.

data.title: TabContainer's tab_changed signal runs every time you click tab
data.body:
<!--
README: Incompatibilities and broken features in the current master branch / 3.0-alpha
are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!
-->

**Operating system or device - Godot version:** 
v2.1.2 (on Steam)

**Issue description:**
The tab_changed( int tab ) does not only run when you change tab, it also runs when you select a tab regardless if you are changing it. ([Video example at 6:06'ish](https://youtu.be/00569Osm-OM?t=6m4s))


**Steps to reproduce:**
- Create a TabContainer with a few tabs.
- Setup the "tab_changed( int tab ) signal from TabContainer
- Make it print some text when the signal runs
- Play the scene and click the same tab over and over again


**Link to minimal example project:**
https://mega.nz/#!oQNxCZTJ!k2o2y6I5do4fqKFkaE9abWSRIRY91VD4z1VJxXHQMaw (Project used in the video example)

data.title: Mobile launcher app for data.pck games
data.body:
Since all your game can be put in a data file ( data.pak ) with no change to the binary would it not make sense to have a official Godot meta launcher for the supported mobile OS'es.

And by meta launcher I mean an app already on the appstore(s) that can 'catch' .godot files ( renamed ,pak files ) from a browser and save/launch them.

For professional games that obviously wont do, but it would be a massive boon to hobbyists that are just getting started as it would be a lower barrier to entry to try mobile development.

In case your wondering; it can be done, and shouldn't violate the ToS of the stores as Minecraft already does this with it's .mcworld files ( which contains both data and code )

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Android/iOS/Blackberry - 3.0 ?

**Issue description:**
Mobile development has a barrier to entry so high it may well deter people from ever trying


**Steps to reproduce:**
Make a game and decide that it would be a good fit for mobile
